engineering_design_principles.mechanism: The use of a master plan (DNA molecule) to create a blueprint (RNA molecule) for the construction of specific protein structures.

The use of a specialized engineering tool, the RNA polymerase, to move along the DNA template, unzipping the double helix and mathematically translating the geometric pattern of nucleotide bases into a complementary RNA sequence.
The implementation of precise geometrical movements and calculations to ensure the accurate conversion of genetic information from DNA to RNA.
